definition: Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
long robe (old)
surname Yuan
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
surname Shi
surname Kai
triumphant/victorious/chi (Greek letter Χχ)

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the 1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱迅速篡奪了辛亥革命的勝利果實。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai forced emperor to abdicate and hand over power to him.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱逼迫皇帝遜位，把政權交給了他。

sentences.english: Yuan Shih-Kai once promised to uphold Republican principles.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱曾經信誓旦旦，說要堅持共和原則。

sentences.english: ‘Go and tell Yuan Shikai nicely that he must save us.’
sentences.chinese: 去告訴袁世凱，請他來救我們吧。

sentences.english: The second part is an analysis of the members of the council of Yuan Shikai.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分則對袁世凱幕府成員進行了分析歸類。

sentences.english: Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱迅速篡奪了辛亥革命的勝利果實。

sentences.english: The author also evaluates Yu an Shikai and his policies under the Late Qing Reform.
sentences.chinese: 作者還對袁世凱與北洋新政作了評價。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱迅速篡奪了辛亥革命的勝利果實。

sentences.english: The council of Yuan Shikai is the representative of this new system.
sentences.chinese: 這一種新型的幕府，袁世凱幕府便是其中代表之一。

sentences.english: It is external manifestation of army construction that he paid attention to weaponry .
sentences.chinese: 重視武器裝備，是袁世凱軍隊建設的外在表現形式。

definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Puyi, personal name of the last Qing emperor (reigned as child 1909-1911), the subject of Bertolucci's biopic The Last Emperor
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
regime/political power
Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
military clique/junta/warlord
to found a state/to open a closed country
